alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 2:34PM MST until January 05 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 11 inches, except 6 to 19 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph especially for the ridge tops. Blowing and drifting of snow is expected. * WHERE...Emigration Summit, Wayan, Pine Creek Pass, and Swan Valley. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible at times. Patchy blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Brief white out conditions are likely, especially for higher elevations. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and will bring blowing and drifting of snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Reschedule travel plans if at possible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range
